content.about: The Department of Chemistry came into existence since the inception of IIT Jammu in 2016. Initially, the department was maintained by the faculty members of IIT Delhi. From 2017 onwards new faculty members started to join the department and till now the department has four faculty members and two more will be joining soon.

content.about: We are a department of 7 faculty members, steadily rising in impact and number since the Institute's inception in 2016. The Department's diverse and overlapping research, ranging from Philosophy to Literatures in English to Economics to Sociology, is a testament to the vast potential of the Humanities and Social Sciences. Our research queries and pursuits are in line with the larger vision of the Institute: to enable collaborative interventions that are humanistic, creative, and have a social impact.

content.admission_process: The admission to UG programme is done through Joint Entrance Examination - Advanced (JEE-Advanced) rank and administered by the Joint Admission Board (JAB) through centralized counseling conducted by JoSSA at the all-India level.

content.about: The Department of Mathematics was started in 2016 together with the establishment of IIT Jammu. The vision of the department is to become a centre of excellence in Mathematics through high quality research and teaching.
content.teaching: The department is offering various core and elective courses for all B. Tech. streams. Apart from this the department is also offering a minor programme in Mathematics. The minor programme in Mathematics is designed to allow undergraduate students to pursue a more rigorous education in mathematics.
content.research: The department has at present energetic and dedicated faculty members in many diverse areas of mathematics. Currently, the main areas of research of the faculty members are Differential Equations, Numerical Analysis, Commutative Algebra, Group Theory, Number Theory, Finite Fields, Probability theory and Stochastic Processes.

content.about: The Department of Physics at IIT Jammu is an academic-oriented research institution where teaching and research are integral components of our mission.

In line with the institute's broad vision, the department vision and mission focuses on directional research towards product realization - ideas, devices, processes. Envisioning a research-based teaching environment. Research for impact: Becoming the trendsetter. Popularizing Physics - outreach, local challenges.

laboratories.name: Material Research Laboratory (MRL)
laboratories.description: The MRL is a multidisciplinary research lab developing novel materials with enhanced physical and chemical properties for a wide range of electrochemical energy storage applications. The lab focuses on the design and development of nanoporous carbons, metal oxides, and polymers for applications such as batteries, supercapacitors, and hybrid energy storage devices.

laboratories.name: Solar Research Lab (SRL)
laboratories.description: The SRL focuses on solar energy harvesting and the development of solar cells. The lab is equipped with advanced facilities for the fabrication and characterization of solar cells.

laboratories.name: Shivalik Plasma Laboratory
laboratories.description: The Shivalik Plasma Laboratory conducts research on plasma physics, including strongly coupled plasma, dusty plasma, and plasma agriculture. The lab is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities for plasma research.

laboratories.name: Optoelectronics and Device Physics Laboratory
laboratories.description: The Optoelectronics and Device Physics Laboratory focuses on the fundamental aspects of light-matter interaction and the development of optoelectronic devices. The lab is equipped with sophisticated instruments for device fabrication and characterization, including Raman Spectroscopy, Photoluminescence, and Electroluminescence spectroscopy.

It is also the youngest of the basic branches of the engineering discipline. A chemical engineer works in a place like the one seen in the image above. They are responsible for converting any raw material to a finished product, may it be petrol from crude oil, synthetic rubber from rubber sap, tea bags from tea leaves, sugar from sugarcane, the list goes on.

content.about: The Department of Civil Engineering (CE) of IIT Jammu, one of six engineering departments, was started in the year 2017. The department offers four-year undergraduate courses, training the students in multiple core disciplines including Structural Analysis and Design, Traffic Engineering, Hydraulics, Construction Management, Environment Engineering, and Surveying, as well as exposure to interdisciplinary projects to enhance collaborative efforts and hone entrepreneurship skills.

content.about: The department offers B.Tech. and Ph.D. in relevant areas. The vision of the department is to develop leaders of tomorrow and conduct translational research to address major technological bottlenecks. We are in the process of developing state-of-the-art laboratories that not only cater to the undergraduate curriculum but also foster research in various specialized and interdisciplinary areas.

content.about: The Mechanical Engineering Department of IIT Jammu was established in 2016 and is one of the three founding departments of the Institute. It offers B.Tech., M.Tech., and Ph.D. programs. The department aims to train tomorrow's engineers and leaders and conduct translational research in an effort to remove technological barriers. It has twenty faculty members, four staff members, one hundred and forty-four undergraduate students (I, II, III, and IV year students), and twenty-five M.Tech. (Thermal and Energy Systems) students, and forty-five PhD students. With state-of-the-art machinery and cutting-edge technology, the department houses multiple undergraduate and research laboratories that support both undergraduate education and research in a variety of specialized and interdisciplinary fields, which include mechanical design, materials science, additive and micro-manufacturing processes, biomechanics, tribology, dynamics, composites, nuclear engineering, energy systems, turbulence and compressible fluid flow.
content.address: Department of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Jammu

content.about: The Mechanical Engineering Department of IIT Jammu was established in 2016 and is one of the three founding departments of the Institute. It offers B.Tech., M.Tech., and Ph.D. programs. The department aims to train tomorrow's engineers and leaders and conduct translational research in an effort to remove technological barriers. It has twenty faculty members, four staff members, one hundred and forty-four undergraduate students (I, II, III, and IV year students), and twenty-five M.Tech. (Thermal and Energy Systems) students, and forty-five PhD students. With state-of-the-art machinery and cutting-edge technology, the department houses multiple undergraduate and research laboratories that support both undergraduate education and research in a variety of specialized and interdisciplinary fields, which include mechanical design, materials science, additive and micro-manufacturing processes, biomechanics, tribology, dynamics, composites, nuclear engineering, energy systems, turbulence and compressible fluid flow.
